results.firPara: The Inter captains incendiary remarks provoked a mixed reaction among supporters against Cagliari but his penalty miss did little to help matters
results.secPara: The Inter captains incendiary remarks provoked a mixed reaction among supporters against Cagliari but his penalty miss did little to help matters
results.webTitle: Mauro Icardi v Inter's Ultras: an unhappy chapter in his ongoing San Siro saga

results.firPara: You will rarely hear anything like the joyful relief that greets a first home win of the season. Steve McClarens second spell in charge of Derby County began as his first did, with victory against Leeds United, this one their first at the IPro Stadium since April. Crowd and manager, the latter reappointed this week 17 months after being sacked, sighed deeply when the 1-0 win was confirmed.
results.secPara: McClaren left his seat in the stands in favour of the bench only for the final part of each half, presumably because it would be poor form to pace frantically around the directors box. When pitchside he was repeatedly shooed back into the technical area by the ever-officious fourth official, once catching himself stepping over the line and ostentatiously hopping back in. Afterwards he was asked how he had found his second Derby debut. Endure is the word, not enjoy. Especially the last 10 minutes.
results.webTitle: Steve McClaren needs time to rebuild Derby County and nurture potential | Nick Miller

results.firPara: Todays piffle is floating in the breeze
results.secPara: Todays piffle is floating in the breeze
results.webTitle: Football transfer rumours: Mauro Icardi to Arsenal, Memphis Depay to Milan?

results.firPara: One of the curiosities of the last international break was the ineffectual performance of Theo Walcott for England against Malta and Slovenia. Put him back in an Arsenal shirt, however, and it was as if a switch had been flicked. The 27-year-old scored twice to set his team up for a 3-2 home win over Swansea City and it prolonged his eye-catching start to the club season. He is Arsenals top scorer, with seven goals in all competitions. Its always difficult when you go from your club to international, theres a different transition at this moment in time with England and you play with different players, Walcott said. You have to get used to the way you play all over again and it is difficult to get into the rhythm of things. Happily for Arsenal, Walcotts rhythm and focus is in sync with them. David Hytner
results.webTitle: Premier League: 10 talking points from the weekend’s action

results.firPara: • Portuguese says his captain can play everywhere and is first-choice

results.webTitle: José Mourinho: I am not to blame for confusion over Wayne Rooney’s role

results.firPara: Manchester United have been more positive, if uneven, under José Mourinho than under Louis van Gaal but expect the Portuguese to make keeping things tight the priority at Anfield
results.secPara: José Mourinhos Manchester United tenure started with an insistence that in thought and style his side would always be on the front foot. In play here was a pressing need to assure fans his arrival meant an end to the default position of cautiousness that marked the United of his predecessor Louis van Gaal.
results.webTitle: Expect José Mourinho to opt for customary caution in Liverpool test | Jamie Jackson

results.firPara: Arsène Wenger has said Arsenal may have to break the bank to secure Mesut Özil to a new long-term contract and also prove to him the club can satisfy his ambitions by winning the league title. The midfielders deal expires in the summer of 2018 and negotiations are continuing over fresh terms.
results.secPara: Wenger was asked to give an update on the situation after Arsenals 3-2 home win against Swansea City on Saturday – in which Özil scored his teams third goal – and it was plain the parties remain a distance apart. Özil earns a reported basic wage of £140,000 a week but he is seeking a substantial rise to reinforce his status as one of the clubs marquee players.
results.webTitle: Arsenal may have to break the bank to keep Mesut Özil beyond 2018

results.firPara: Jürgen Klopp has ridiculed suggestions José Mourinho is a manager in decline and insisted his rival remains a fierce competitor who knows how to restore success at Manchester United.
results.secPara: Liverpool could open up a six-point lead over United and go joint top of the Premier League with victory at Anfield on Monday. While Klopp has created a clear style of play at Anfield, and Pep Guardiola likewise at Manchester City, Mourinho is yet to have a similar impact at Old Trafford or settle on a consistent team.
results.webTitle: Jürgen Klopp dismisses claims that José Mourinho’s influence is waning

results.firPara: Leicester Citys frustrated players have pointed to a lack of fight undermining their defence of the Premier League title as they struggle to balance the demands of domestic and European commitments.
results.secPara: Claudio Ranieris ailing side were dismissed emphatically by Chelsea at Stamford Bridge on Saturday, a defeat which ensured they became the first team to lose the first four away games of their league defence since Blackburn Rovers 21 years ago. Spluttering form has left the champions with eight points from as many games, with their experienced players exasperated by the lack of spirit demonstrated to date this term.
results.webTitle: Marc Albrighton insists Leicester City players realise they have to fight more

results.firPara: Harry Kane is poised to return to the training pitch on Monday after being sidelined for a month and Tottenham Hotspur are cautiously optimistic that there will be more encouraging injury news about Toby Alderweireld, who is due to undergo a scan after he was taken off on a stretcher on Saturday.
results.secPara: Although Alderweireld was in a lot of pain at the time of the injury, the Belgian was able to walk out of The Hawthorns after the 1-1 draw with West Bromwich Albion. Mauricio Pochettino has ruled Alderweireld out of the Champions League away game against Bayer Leverkusen on Tuesday, but Spurs are hopeful that the damage to the central defenders knee is not too severe and that he could be looking at weeks, rather than months, in the treatment room.
results.webTitle: Tottenham Hotspur optimistic over Toby Alderweireld’s knee injury
